website_summaries.verdict: The Western Digital My Net N900 HD is a whole new kind of Wireless-N router. At release, the router is a decent investment for home users but will need better firmware to work at its full potential.
pros: The Western Digital My Net N900 HD dual-band router offers a fresh approach to wireless routers with seven Gigabit LAN ports and an effective FastTrack Plus QoS feature
The router's 5Ghz band and its storage feature also performed very well
cons: The My Net N900's 2.4Ghz band could use improvement
The router doesn't support 802.11ac, nor does it have an easy way for users to access its connected USB external drive over the Internet

customer_reviews.title: Great router for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have owed this product for over three years and is has functions extremely well. I live in a long large ranch home and the router has great connectivity throughout my entire house, garage and deck as well as into the yard surrounding the house. The router is easy to reboot if a system problem occur and I have never had an issue with it. I am not very tech savvy and found this router simple to setup and maintain. I have recommended the router to many friends. It is a great router for the price.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Range is terrible
customer_reviews.text: I'm not really tek savvy but I do like it when things work as expected and hate it when they don't. I needed a dual band router for our B&B so that the guests were on a different band than the business, thus keeping our personal information safe. The wifi speed may be good but the range is terrible. Guests couldn't move out of the middle of the house and couldn't get wifi at all up in their rooms. I had to buy a range extender to be able to use this effectively which just added to the total cost. Before this router I had one that reached every square inch of property (but wasn't dual band).
customer_reviews.author: LodgingLady

customer_reviews.title: great value
customer_reviews.text: After reading through all the reviews, I decided to choose this router. The price of this compared to its capabilities is incredible. Be forewarned, I do not have any complicated needs in my wireless system. I have two laptops, two cell phones and one tablet that are used regularly over wireless and a PS3 that is used with an ethernet cable. I plan in the future to use the printing options but at this time have not yet. All in all, this router was the easiest I have ever set up. I used the included disc and it went without any problem at all. I have used it for about a month now and haven't had any issues yet.
customer_reviews.author: william

customer_reviews.title: ... 4 of these because I thought they were a great combo. Wifi router with 7 gigabit ethernet connections
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 of these because I thought they were a great combo. Wifi router with 7 gigabit ethernet connections. The idea was to use 1 as router, and the others as access points to cover my hole house. But the one I use as router was failing and failing. I decided to switch units, the same result. Sometimes they work just fine, other they do not. So I had to buy another Router (Asus). Then I switch all of these into Access points. The last firmware upgrade dates from 2013. I am sure there is something wrong with the firmware. WD should provide support for these, even they do not do them anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Stefan

customer_reviews.title: WD router
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my aging Cisco Linksys WRT110 with the WD My Net N900 about 2 months ago. Despite updating the software, my Linksys was disconnecting from the internet multiple times a day and failing to reconnect. Since replacing I've only been disconnected once. I wanted a router that would handle the increased load of 2 wireless TV's and my smart phone and this works flawlessly. The only reason I withheld from rating it 5 stars is the wireless printer/shared storage (2 USB ports) don't connect as easily as advertised. Even using the Dashboard app, it requires a bit more time and instruction to configure. So other than that, it works well and easily handles video streaming to several devices simultaneously.
customer_reviews.author: Louis P.

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, 7 ethernet ports is great for me
customer_reviews.text: One star for tech support because I assume it no longer would be valid. 7 ethernet ports which is why I purchased. Small 1000 ft square house for me, this does the job.. Like the other guy below said, you have to go into router settings to turn off that one traffic feature. I probably have to reset every few days which isn't a big deal to power cycle modem. Firmware hasn't been released since 2013....
customer_reviews.author: Ryan V.

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE - wireless drops out constantly
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router based on a CNET review that had it in the top 10 routers, no idea what they were talking about. It drops wireless connections constantly causing PC's, Ipads, Iphones, and other devices to lose connections. You can't reconnect without a reboot. I googled the issue and found this has been going on for years with this router! Search this router an dropped connections and you get back tons of results, all the same complaints, and updating to latest firmware and other fixes don't work. Do yourself a favor, get a different router.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Good router!
customer_reviews.text: Since retiring and building a new home in Florida, I needed a new router (the existing one was used for about a year in a temporary apartment out of state). I have nothing bad to say about this router. I especially like the number of ports on the back of the unit. AFAIK everyone else only has 4. The router is installed in my home office and only has one port free now. One port is used to feed an HP Procurve switch that is mounted in the wiring closet in the MBR closet. Most rooms in the house are wired for CAT6. I have not seen any problems yet with the router.
customer_reviews.author: KevMeist

customer_reviews.title: Incredible router (although it may be worth going for an ...
customer_reviews.text: Incredible router (although it may be worth going for an A/C router now). Our old N could not handle going from our downstairs (where the cable came in) to the upstairs where our roku and laptops were. This puts the signal up through the walls with no problem. Initial reviews had complaints about restarts or downtime, but this has been the most stable router I have ever owned (after updating the firmware).
customer_reviews.author: M & S Kirsch

customer_reviews.title: JUNK
customer_reviews.text: Total failure. Would not see wireless printer. Did not show hard drive plugged into USB. Would not even install CD software supplied. Kept saying installation incomplete. Web site would not even let me register the piece of crap to send an email asking why the router would not work. What a total piece of work this was. WD will not enter my house again after this experience. An item like this nowadays should be total PNP. My last two routers were. Wished they would have lasted more then 2 years. This one did not last a day. But it was a very frustrating day not to be forgotten.
customer_reviews.author: I'm a User 52

customer_reviews.title: cosmetically nice without reliability inside
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for about 6 months, then it began to stop sending the signa,l with more frequency as time went on. Finally stopped working all together after about 1 year. I had high hopes for this router - it has a lot going for it,. Movin' on.......
customer_reviews.author: Wig

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy the "WD My Net N900 Dual Band Wireless Router"
customer_reviews.text: After reading multiple tech reviews, I bought this router as a Christmas gift. The recipient has had ongoing wireless connectivity issues since the start of 2015 with her HP printer which was not a problem with her prior Time-Warner Netgear router. I attempted to find and correct the issue, but was unable to resolve it. We ended up using the USB cable option. Wireless never worked. Based on this experience, I cannot recommend this router.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: I was really wanting this to be a great router...
customer_reviews.text: The router was a breeze to hook up and the interface is great. That being said though, it drops connection on the 5Ghz frequently and the range isn't near what I had with an older Linksys G router that it replaced. In fairness, it's in an apartment building with no less than 20 other wifi signals to contend with, but so was the Linksys. When it is working great I love it, I stream 3 Roku boxes at a time as well as a couple tablets and a NAS setup. luckily I got this for a great deal, so I'm not too upset.
customer_reviews.author: William M. Merritt

customer_reviews.title: Great Router
customer_reviews.text: Bought this router to replace a Linksy 2.4GHZ-G router. The wireless range on the old router was very limited, almost had to be in the room next door. N900 changed that. I can get a very strong signal all over the house and into the garage and beyond with the N900. Like to use my Galaxy Tablet in the kitchen for recipes online and in the garage for diy projects. Could never do that with the Linksys. Set up was a breeze. 5 minutes max. Like the two USB ports for printer sharing. You have to install WD Print share on each computer on your network - not a big deal. Love the router.
customer_reviews.author: M F Clark

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what it says it will do
customer_reviews.text: This wifi router is the best thing that has happened to our streaming experience yet. For our primary entertainment system, which is on a different floor than the wifi router, this device has drastically reduced the load times for services like Netflix and HBO Go, while also boosting the wifi signal by a full bar for other devices. For example, Netflix movies used to take 9-13 seconds to start, but they now consistently start in less than 3 seconds. HBO Go content used to take between 12 and 20 seconds to start, but it now consistently takes less than 6 seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It worked fine for about 3 months but then the internet connection ...
customer_reviews.text: I've never had so many issues with a wireless router. It worked fine for about 3 months but then the internet connection stopped working at random ; you can imagine how frustrating that is when your're streaming music or movies. Apparently this is a common issue if you read the forum for this product so I am inclined to think it was not specifically my unit and thus I am giving this product a bad rating. My first 1 of 5 product rating ever on amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Jimbo Baloba

customer_reviews.title: Just got it - so far I love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first wifi router, replacing my router that was several years old. It's fast, easy to setup and manage, once I figured out the password setups (there are three places to set up passwords???). Great price for all the features. This model was featured on PCMag as one of the top 10 best wifi routers, rating almost as high as much more expensive modes with not much better features. I'm not a techie, am grateful when a product "lets me" set it up and use it without needing expert assistance. Am happy!
customer_reviews.author: marciast

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre Router
customer_reviews.text: I lost my first router to a lightning strike (D-LINK DIR-655 Extreme-N) after 3 years of use and I sincerely wish I just bought that one again. This router has less range, is less consistent and seems to somehow deliver slow internet. It is functional and, for the most part, does its job but it has left me underwhelmed in every way.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Ryan

customer_reviews.title: 7 ports!
customer_reviews.text: Works well if you're going to hard wire. 5g Wifi is a joke on this router. 2g works better but the 5g is 0 bars 20 feet away. I was really hoping to use my dual band wifi connection on my desktop after I moved. Wifi works around my house for my phone, through a couple thick lead based paint walls. I run everything over the wire though so I went for this to have extra ports. Port forwarding took me another 30 second tutorial but great deal for me.
customer_reviews.author: Non Paid Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: OVERHEATING PROBLEM
customer_reviews.text: I give this four stars because I found the solution to it locking up and dropping WiFi every day or so. The dang thing overheats so easily, definitely a design flaw on the part of WD. Put a laptop cooling pad under the N900 and no more lockups or dropped signals. Otherwise, great router and very good signal over my old Cisco. Would I recommend this to others, NO - not until WD fix the overheating issue.
customer_reviews.author: DigiKiwamTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Unstable connection and simply a big headache!
customer_reviews.text: Constantly dropped internet and wireless connections. Could not get help resolving issue and all I could find online was the same issue from others who reported their calls to WD in which their assistance didn't work and they ended up being advised to simply return the router. Not user friendly or reliable and, for the price, a big headache and disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Brett D. Crowell

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be working fine so far
customer_reviews.text: On amazon.com the description of the router included this statement: What's in the box: HD dual-band router, Setup and resource CD, Ethernet cable, Power adapter, Quick Install Guide. In reality, the Setup and resource CD and Quick Install Guide weren't in the box. After searching the web a while, I finally found a site that had the download version and was able to perform the setup. Seems to be working fine so far.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: Keeps dropping connection and interface is clunky
customer_reviews.text: When the wifi is working properly, everything is good. However, once in a few hours it just drops the wifi connection. The wifi will still be connected but internet doesn't work. I think its some firewall feature in this which is basically broken. I have to switch the router off and on and it'll work again. The interface is also very clunky. It keeps asking me to register and the link doesn't work. You cannot dismiss notifications. They will always be there!
customer_reviews.author: Karthik

customer_reviews.title: gig ports, cheap
customer_reviews.text: The recent and dramatic price drop on this and other WD routers made me take a look at it. Works fine for what I use it for. Small issue with the dns proxy which is default (using the router as dns server in dhcp). Would take extra 10 seconds or so on initial lookup. I turned it off and just put in dns servers in the dhcp settings, that took care of it. It shows up in my ps3, samsung tv, and Logitech revue as a media server. Haven't tried that yet.
customer_reviews.author: dktt

customer_reviews.title: Easy of Set up, Ease of Use, Who Knew Western Digital Makes More than Just Hard Drives
customer_reviews.text: Great dual band wireless router at a bargain price and a pleasant surprise to see Western Digital makes other quality products besides hard drives. Easy set up and the ability to create two sets dual band accounts -- one set for yourself and another set for guests. It was up and running in less than half an hour from the time I opened the package. Plenty of ethernet ports and usb port to add external hard drive or network a printer.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Goldstein

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect but good value for the price
customer_reviews.text: Have had to reboot this and the WD My Net switch several times since setting it up. Twice after consecutive power outages and once after moving several cables. It did survive the most recent power outage without a restart. The 2.4 range is about the same as my OLD linksys. The 5 HZ range is definitely less. If the track record improves I plan to add a second as a wifi extender b/c the WD extender is either 2.4 or 5 not true dual band.
customer_reviews.author: MickPB

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up.. My one reservation is that I don't think the coverage is not great.. I live in a modest house, 2100 sq ft.. I put the router in my office which is in the den on the first floor. I find that the coverage is not great on the second floor, in the bedroom which is almost directly over the office but yet both my Mac and Windows machine report only average wifi coverage.. If the goal is to get a reliable router that is easy to set up, this is for you.
customer_reviews.author: D. OConnor

customer_reviews.title: Intermittent Disconnects
customer_reviews.text: If it worked consistently, this would be a great router. However, mine currently is freezing several times a day and requires a reboot. This is extremely annoying and seems to always happen at the worst times - either when trying to complete a work deadline or when I'm trying to finish a game level on Xbox. I've contacted WD support, which their website says the router is "Out of Warranty" even though I've just had it a month. I'm wondering if I was sold a refurb. I'll update my post here if I get any positive answers. But right now, I'd avoid buying this again, if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Jaycen Russell

customer_reviews.title: Meh, don't buy it. Speeds are very false
customer_reviews.text: Out of box performance is ok but not great. 2.4ghz range is alright, 5ghz range is horrendous (its not AC, its wireless N so expected, but its super bad) Needs occasional rebooting. Not compatible with OpenSource firmware, limited options in configuration interface. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: sina

customer_reviews.title: This was VERY easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: This was VERY easy to set up. I didn't have much trouble at all. However, it doesn't pick up very well in some areas of my house (1 story, 2800 square feet). I was hoping for a little better reception - but this definitely wasn't the priciest model. So you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Alli K

customer_reviews.title: We like our new: WD My Net N900 HD Dual Band Router Wireless N WiFi Router Accelerate HD
customer_reviews.text: Our router arrived in perfect condition. The CD that was provided made the installation very easy. We are presently using it along with an old DSL Modem with Century Link Service. This service just barely meets the criteria, but is functioning fine for us. We are on WiFi now as first time users. We are running our desktop computer, a tablet and our I-Phones on the service. We have been up and running for about a month now. JUST RIGHT! THANK YOU!
customer_reviews.author: K & P Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Broke in 2 days
customer_reviews.text: I have asus rt-53 but bought this for my girlfriend for her use at home. Downloaded latest software and installed with ease. It is really easy--that's why I give it one full star. After two days of testing, broke. Had to restart it couple times. My gf is technically challenged so I know she would never figure out what had gone wrong. Compared to my asus i've had for over a year that I had never had to restart it, I am disappointed with this router. Go with asus, look at reviews. This router's heading back to amazon.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great...
customer_reviews.text: This router does the job. I was replacing an old Lynksys (which the range was better on). The range is surpisingly small compared to my old router, especially the 5g broadcast. I called WD support several times because I thought mine was defective. According to them its functioning properly. Aside from range it is a good router and handles the load of a few iphones, tablets, laptops etc connected to it.
customer_reviews.author: jkaz

customer_reviews.title: WD My Net N900
customer_reviews.text: When it works it's fine. The first one started dropping the connections every now and then after a month of use. I called WD and the customer service was great. They shipped another one out the next day. This one has dropped the connection a couple of times but nothing drastic yet. I am Ethernet connected to it so I don't notice it but my son does when playing games on his Xbox.
customer_reviews.author: Charles A. Upton

customer_reviews.title: More ports than you can shake... well you know!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when it was on clearance and was $20, I was great for me. Never had it drop on me and i had my Smartthings, PC and Nest Camera on it.
customer_reviews.author: Sho

customer_reviews.title: Good when it works....
customer_reviews.text: Stops broadcasting Wifi. This router will suddenly stop broadcasting it ID on both the 2.4 and 5 GHz. I reboot it and it will work for a month or two and then quit. The first time it would just keep dropping the connection and the next time it just stopped broadcasting. At any rate it is a dud. I will have to go through WD (like I have two times for an internal laptop hard drive) RMA........
customer_reviews.author: Glenn M

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and a great deal
customer_reviews.text: It was on a deep discount (list price was almost 200, but got it for ~60). Very easy to set up (though I am tech savvy), seems very fast, and I liked the fact that it had eight hardwired ethernet ports vs. the usual 4 on a consumer grade item. UI was friendly but does ultimately expose all the options you might want to tweak. Haven't tried the device sharing (printer/hard drive). But no complaints overall, great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: culture vulture

customer_reviews.title: WD N900 Dual Band Router - Great step up
customer_reviews.text: Just a few quick words regarding my new WD N900 router. It's awwwsum! I got it to replace a failing Linksys router that had given me years of good service, but recently had begun to show sighs that it was about to go to that great place in the ethernet. It was quick & easy to set up & has worked as advertised, which is usually more than you can ask for. But, in this case, I have tested my i-net speeds & found them to be outstanding. This is one case where I got what I paid for! jim
customer_reviews.author: Capt. Jim

customer_reviews.title: Watch out for dropped signal
customer_reviews.text: Loved this when I first got it despite reviews that warned it repeatedly dropped signal. After a few months mine started to do the same. Here I am almost a year after purchase and much procrastination looking to return/replace it, and I've found out the return window expired 2 months after purchase. Well darn, wish I had listened to the reviewers that warned of the constant signal drop and not ordered it.
customer_reviews.author: Nina O

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Mine broke just after the warranty expired. Not because it was dropped or anything, but as the tech support said, it was because I moved and it would not accept the new settings at my new residence. Ridiculous. I like WD for their hard drives, but I will not be buying another wireless router from them in the future unless they extend to a lifetime warranty, like Netgear has on many of their products.
customer_reviews.author: Badger

customer_reviews.title: Don't do it
customer_reviews.text: Quite possibly the worst experience. Perfect gift for someone you dislike. Wish it were biodegradeable so it could at least feed the weeds. Money out the window and nearly a year of suffering, I bit the bullet and took the thing off my network. Walking away from this one.
customer_reviews.author: Kim P

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, easy to use, lot of ethernet ports
customer_reviews.text: Very light and has more ethernet ports than most people will probably think about using. It feels kind of cheap but definitely does not look cheap. The settings GUI looks good and is easy to use. I have been using this for my apartment and my dad has now purchased one because of the sheer amount of ethernet ports built in. Great product from WD
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Wardlaw

customer_reviews.title: 2nd unit- just won't connect to the internet...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to try and upgrade my working-fine WRT-160NL Linksys. I had high hopes to have a greate HD router with 7 ethernet gates. After an hour with tech support, I turned in the first unit thinking surely this is a defective unit. Here comes the 2nd unit, and the exact same issue- won't connect to the internet. When I try to recall tech support, I get "now closed- open 8 am to 4 pm Pacific time." enough is enough...
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Smooch

customer_reviews.title: Good, but DHCP server cannot handle load
customer_reviews.text: Love the product with only one major exception. The DHCP server reliability is questionable. I yearly host what is arguably the largest LAN party in the Minneapolis area and this router performs well under load. That is assuming the DHCP server actually handed you an IP address. Under load, the DHCP server freezes up. This is given the Feb 2013 firmware update. If you get anywhere above 15 devices while also having load, avoid this router. Requests to the DHCP server will freeze.
customer_reviews.author: RubesMN

customer_reviews.title: Not sure I'll ever buy from WD again!
customer_reviews.text: First one didn't work for farther than 5 feet. Manufacturer sent a "replacement", which turned out to be a used, non-working "recertified" model from which the previous user's settings had not even been cleared! What a terrible product and a bad customer service experience. The standard warranty I purchased doesn't cover this, nor does Amazon's 30-day return policy. I am out the entire cost of the router.
customer_reviews.author: Zod

customer_reviews.title: Dual does not work
customer_reviews.text: Constantly drops the 2.4ghz network, essentially making it a single band router for the price of a dual. Won't buy WD routers again, as this is a known and unresolved issue
customer_reviews.author: B. Healy

customer_reviews.title: Not a great investment
customer_reviews.text: I was dissapointed in the router's range and ability to maintain higher data transfer speeds. I am a fan of WD, so this came as a surprise to me.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Miller

customer_reviews.title: Easy for Seniors to set up
customer_reviews.text: I previously bought a well known brand of router and I was unable to ever make it work as it should. I gave up and looked for something I could use. This is it. It is simple to set up which is great for older users. I have set up a guest for a sister and a friend, both of whom are Seniors. Also this router cost less than a third of my previous router.
customer_reviews.author: Cranky old guy

customer_reviews.title: WD builds great hard drives.  Not so with routers.
customer_reviews.text: When I plug my two WD external hard drives in which work great the router recognizes them for a while then looses them. Now it will only recognize one of them. Reset works for a while then the same thing happens. What's the point of having 2 usb ports when the router only recognizes one and won't share both with my network? Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: anon

customer_reviews.title: works
customer_reviews.text: not many problems.. have to reset once in a while easy set u p this product does everything is said it would in the advertisement, it was packaged well and arrived quickly. this product will be very useful and I am very happy with the purchase. I would highly recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: darin

customer_reviews.title: WD MY NET N900 HD Dual Band Router Wireless Is Easy to Set Up
customer_reviews.text: My WD dual band wireless router arrived promptly and was very easy to set up. What impresses me most about this router is its 7 ports, usually I've had only 4 at the most! I was also very pleased with the price of this router. After reading several reviews about different dual band wireless N routers, I chose this WD My Net N900 because of the price, ease of set up and its 7 ports! It works great!
customer_reviews.author: Shelia W Frances

customer_reviews.title: Had for two years buuut....
customer_reviews.text: Had it for two years so far. It overheats often and the fans don't kick in. Finally had to switch to my other router due to overheating issues happening more frequently. Gave two stars instead of one because it DID last two years.
customer_reviews.author: Amber R Bosch

customer_reviews.title: Router gremlins, Set up lacking.
customer_reviews.text: Well, I'm no techie kinda guy. I got it installed & operating, I think. We have WiFi again, but, my Motorola Cell Phone now will not open Web pages at all! And, when using Google Phone/Call the lap top drops the call repeatedly. So did I miss something in the set up? Don't know. It is less than my old WiFi Router, which just lost it's power cord. So now I don't know what to do..Oh, and my Wife's laptop will not connect via wireless, has to use the wire! This sounds like a tech support chat..
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Lea

customer_reviews.title: When new is really not new
customer_reviews.text: I did my research and thought I picked a new out of the box product, but that was not the case. The installation went smooth, but when I tried to register it I was informed that this router was almost 2 years past the warranty period. So I was basically s.o.l. for any real support on product updates or anything else. I tried a variety of things to make this router run properly, but at the end I unplugged it and went to Walmart for a new NetGear router that is running perfectly. Never again!!
customer_reviews.author: Steve V

customer_reviews.title: Better than Comcast Gateway
customer_reviews.text: At first, the setup had an issue, but once i called customer support, it was a breeze. This was bought to replace the router capability from the Comcast Gateway Modem/Router combo that Comcast rips you off with. I was able to call Comcast Customer Service to have the gateway modem put into "bridge mode", essentially turning it into a cable modem. I then setup this wireless router and have been very pleased with it. The signal is strong and reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher R.

customer_reviews.title: So far...so good
customer_reviews.text: Using for a couple days. So far so good.... As suggested by other reviews, it gets heated.... Fan working good so far. Suggestion: the device should have extra air vents for cooling. UPDATE 09/12/2014 Well this device is some stress. After many days of troubleshooting and restarting, I think I have figured out the problem...There seems to be a conflict when the 'Enhanced WMM' is enabled. Once this is off, everything is OK (for now). UPDATE 09/30/2014 Same s***... different day... Western Digital, please release new firmware to deal with the problem of having to reset ever-so-often. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: RSM

customer_reviews.title: Simple install for the those with limited technical ability. ...
customer_reviews.text: Simple install for the those with limited technical ability. It solved problems that were beginning to develop in my 10 year old router (drops and IP assignment conflicts with newer versions of Windows). While 5 Ghz is there the 2.4 Ghz is what is primarily used due to a large house.
customer_reviews.author: Home Remodeler

customer_reviews.title: Extremely unreliabe
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router as a replacement for D-Link DIR-330 because it promised higher wireless speed and 802.11n support. Now after using it for 4 month I am extremely dissatisfied. The router is unreliable to say the least. Initially I configured it to provide both 2.4ghz and 5ghz wi-fi. 2.4ghz network was constantly disconnecting. I changed configuration to only leave 5hgz and wired connectivity in hopes that it would help with stability. Unfortunately it did not help much, now even wired connectivity disappears. I am going to look for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Oleg Chunikhin

customer_reviews.title: I have had this about a year and it works fine for 3-4 months and then it keeps dropping or ...
customer_reviews.text: Ok product, I have had this about a year and it works fine for 3-4 months and then it keeps dropping or blocking my internet on both wired and wireless devices. The only way i have found to fix this is to reset the router to the factory settings and then go through the setup process again. I even saved my config file and tried to load it after a reset but the same problem persisted(dropped internet signal). If you don't mind resetting your router every few months this works good but i am tired of doing it and am looking for a different router now.
customer_reviews.author: edwin

customer_reviews.title: Worst router ever.
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst router I have ever encountered. Must be rebooted at least once per day, usually more. I have spent a dozen hours pouring through forums, changing settings, trying fixes. Basically this POS has cost me twice its value in lost time. Do not buy this router. Run from it as fast as you can.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Scott

customer_reviews.title: you're better off elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: I'll just echo the same things already expressed by other users. This modem drops my connection at least once a day. Firmware update didn't help and i'm unfortunately past the return time frame. if you're looking to buy this modem, you're better off elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin

customer_reviews.title: Best, most powerful and dependable router I have ever ...
customer_reviews.text: Best, most powerful and dependable router I have ever owned. I have an old house with wire lathe in the walls and it has no problem penetrating walls and a ceiling. I can even pick up a signal a good 75 yards from my house. It's also priced very competitively.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle John

customer_reviews.title: Its ok
customer_reviews.text: Its works, but sometimes the wifi is not stable. I use this more like a router/switch where I have ethernet cables to all my rooms, living and family rooms. I have my Asus wifi router connected to it as well. So I have a choice of wifi connectivity in my house. But didn't fine the wifi on the WD My Net N900 very good. My Asus turned out to be better.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: My Net-work has never been so darn fast!
customer_reviews.text: Wired or wireless, this router seems to be the most efficient way to run your network at optimal speeds. I am a Charter internet customer, the thirty meg service, and this router automatically sets all the speeds to where it would appear that each device is getting the maximum bandwidth available. I have not connected a printer or a USB storage drive yet but unless you see an update, it worked flawlessly. Get it! Don't skimp on a router like I used to, you will not regret your purchase.
customer_reviews.author: apollo

customer_reviews.title: when it works it's great - but usually it doesn't
customer_reviews.text: I loved the dual band capability, particularly for streaming. When it worked it was the best router I've owned. But most of the time the router just didn't work. When it stopped working the software to access the router disappeared. The online community has many people with the same problem, numerous posts without resolution. WD seems unable to fix it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: It was good for the first month afterwards got broken
customer_reviews.author: Linda e. Pimentel

customer_reviews.title: Have to reconnect constantly.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how this router got such high reviews. I find myself having the same problem as others where the wifi (both 2.4 and 5) will lock up multiple times in a day. Wifi streaming is hopeless and I find myself leaving my cell phone on LTE for a few days at a time cause I'm just tired of fighting with this router. I'm sorely disappointed since I paid so much for this device and firmware updates are not solving the issue. Also the LEDs on the front are dismally dim.
customer_reviews.author: Robbi Mount

customer_reviews.title: Excellent router--I live in condo with DSL internet and only ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent router--I live in condo with DSL internet and only have my laptop connected to this router. It connects quickly and I've experienced none of the freezing or rebooting issues that have been mentioned. It's been very reliable and I log in daily without any problems.
customer_reviews.author: leelee

customer_reviews.title: dont buy as even tho this product is new . you dont get a factory warrenty
customer_reviews.text: I have been fighting for weeks now for WD to register the warrenty. I sent invoice and screen shots from amazon to prove its brand new but to no aval. it still reads OUT OF WARRENTY so if you buy this product and somethings goes wrong . say goodbye to the cash you paid for this router
customer_reviews.author: Jaymie

customer_reviews.title: The Search Is Over
customer_reviews.text: I had been looking for a new router after buying a Smart television. It would make it about 20 minutes into programing, then say I had no internet connection. After a rather long battle of trying different mid-priced routers, this seemed to do the trick. We have only had to reset it once! Ludicrously easy set up and such.
customer_reviews.author: plainandtall

customer_reviews.title: Dodgy at best. Avoid it.
customer_reviews.text: I had the exact same experience as Schwartz - constant lock ups despite updated firmware, intermittent signal drops even when the unit was working, and general subpar behavior. I didn't notice any difference in streaming media performance, which was supposed to be this unit's biggest strength. My old netgear is back out and fully functional and this device is headed for the trash pile.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a good pick.  You can do better.  Even if on clearance.
customer_reviews.text: This router has impressive specs. I bought mine in August 2013 on closeout. Now it is December 2014 and the router needs to be unplugged continually. The bios is up to date. The router is still active, but it drops the connection to the internet (modem). Resetting the modem does not help, the problem is in the router. I had an issue in the past with a Netgear and the bios actually had a feature that would reboot the router on a set schedule (dialy, weekly etc). I think WD needs to do this. I plan to replace mine.
customer_reviews.author: R. Sutschek

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with this router
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this router. No major problems installation either, although there are many options to wade through. Low profile and you can sit things on top of it because it has no air vents there--a plus if your space is limited.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Worst router I've ever had - don't buy if you want a consistent Internet connection
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst router I've ever had. It drops connection almost every day and has to be re-booted. I've followed advice found in in a Google search of my problems, such as turning off QoS, doing this, doing that, etc but the router still "freezes". I've also done a reset multiple times to no avail. I've seen several others online that have similar problems but there is no newer firmware since April 2013 to address the problems with it. I've only had it for a few months and can no longer return it but I've already ordered my replacement. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Good Performance
customer_reviews.text: Good Range & Speed Performance, Missing some Tools available in my previous router - such as wireless connectivity signal strength which I find very useful to position wireless devices for best performance, and has limited capacity for entering MAC addresses for filtering access.
customer_reviews.author: Robert S. Burckes

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for the first week or so then it would drop signal. It also lost download speeds, it set up some firewalls that restricted downloads speeds tried to reset but did not fix. The USB port to add an external hard drive comes in handy though.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Beware, connection drops, no update on firmware to fix issues
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router seeing the positive reviews, should of paid attention to the negative ones. The connection drops constantly when playing online on my console, or streaming to the apple tv. Google the issues, it's a well documented. The latest firmware published by WD is from 2013, and no word on a solution coming in. Its a firmware issue, and it won't be solved by WD, getting a replacement won't solved the flawed firmware. Save your money, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Alfonso Carrillo M.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Not nearly the range of my old Netgear. Occasionally stops working and must be power cycled to restart. Wall mounting is a plus, but does not seem to improve range. I would not have purchased if I had known then what I now know about the router.
customer_reviews.author: K. Blake

customer_reviews.title: just what i needed
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 desktops 3 laptops 4 game systems and 5 i phones.My old router fell flat under high demand.I can now run everything at the same time and my hd movies stream perfect and no lagging on any of my devises even under high use.My range is also much farther on my portables.Set up was easy.
customer_reviews.author: billy hunt

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing range signal
customer_reviews.text: The WD was easy to set up, but it lacked the range of other Netgear and Linksys routers I've used, including the N300-N900. Speed was OK but when you moved more than 20-30 feet away, download rates dropped by a factor of 10. Would not recommend based on this issue alone.
customer_reviews.author: W. Sweger

customer_reviews.title: WARNING! DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY. I wanted to like this router. It worked great for a few months but then it became a nightmare. Randomly losing internet connection, DNS problems, terrible wifi range. It's been discontinued and the last firmware update is over a year old. You WILL have issues with it eventually so save yourself some time and a whole lot of aggravation and just pass on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: This router is nothing but trouble
customer_reviews.text: I have spent numerous hours keeping this router running. It frequently needs to be rebooted. After spending hours on the phone with customer support they sent me a replacement but the replacement does the same thing. They refuse to answer my email questions and will not accept a return for refund. This is a high-tech boat anchor. Avoid Western Digital if possible
customer_reviews.author: stephen shaffer

customer_reviews.title: Failed to work properly out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Spoke with MFG tech support who determined router was defective and suggested I return it to vendor. I did not want another WD product at this time. Amazon was amazing in assisting me in the return and the refund - they are really the "go to" folks for merchandise.
customer_reviews.author: Dan of the Desert

customer_reviews.title: Why is this still on the market?
customer_reviews.text: Like many of the other reviewers I had high hopes for this router as it has a lot of features I want and looks good. But when it simply quits working several times a week and has to be rebooted that nullifies any other good points. I've had it too long to return it so into the find-a-new-home-bin it goes and I'll find one that's well-liked by it's owners.
customer_reviews.author: PrimeSuspect

customer_reviews.title: Good range and strong connnection
customer_reviews.text: This router replaced a Belkin Dual Band router that had relatively short range and weak connection. The WD router is as advertised and the set up with my computer was very straight forward with the enclosed CD. and the wireless connection to my printer via WPS was intuitive and simple.
customer_reviews.author: Island guy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works fine, range is good and have not had any problems with it.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Miller

customer_reviews.title: The good things are that it has 2 usb ports to ...
customer_reviews.text: Over heats, Its also takes a while to find the internet. The good things are that it has 2 usb ports to add printer or additional hard drives, also it has fast transfer speeds
customer_reviews.author: Rohan G.

customer_reviews.title: SO FAR SO GOOD
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to purchase because of some of the negative reviews. I purchased anyway and after only a week I am not sorry I did. It was very easy to setup and is working strong for me. I hope it continues to do so, if not I will update this if possible.
customer_reviews.author: J. Jones

customer_reviews.title: works well and makes my online classes easier
customer_reviews.text: without this I wouldn't be able to get my art classes inside the art room and would still be running back and forth from the computer to my painting table. We live in a very rural area. I am happier painting than I have been.
customer_reviews.author: None

customer_reviews.title: New Router for my home network
customer_reviews.text: I got this router for my home network. We have a number of devices on our LAN that get heavy use. We have 3 desktops two laptops 2 android tablets two kindle fires a PS2 and a roku. We also play alot of LAN based games. Been holding up great.
customer_reviews.author: Rejean

customer_reviews.title: WOW works great.
customer_reviews.text: I love the way this has integrated with my patched together network. 3 printers 5 different OS's(win XP,VISTA,7,LINUX,BEOS) 1 satellite modem,2 Directv DVR's It's hard to find a router (let alone any other component)that integrates so well with both wired and wireless devices. just one thing though all my printers are Epson's, 2 are USB and the other wireless.
customer_reviews.author: Timb

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Though it has excellent speed and reception timing, the distance to bar drop is exponential, I can't imagine it actually being good for a large two story house as it claims on the package. Cannot game stream with it as I would have hoped.
customer_reviews.author: Casanova Kurai

customer_reviews.title: Fan DOA, but still works fine
customer_reviews.text: I really like the router so far and it was a great deal for the speed. but unfortunately the fan in mine doesnt work and it overheated slowing my connection to nil. i took the top off and its been working fine since. going to try to figure out whats wrong with the fan when i get around to it. havent used the usb port yet and dont have a 5G phone to test that. But the wifi and internet have been very quick for 2-3 devices running at a time plus 2-4phones.
customer_reviews.author: M.

customer_reviews.title: Nice having 8 gigabit ports!
customer_reviews.text: I love WD products and this is another good one. Super fast speeds with our CAT6 cable home network. There have been only a couple times I've had to reset it, but I'd still buy it again if I had to do it over. The WD software it comes with and the easy WD user interface of changing the router settings brings this one to the top in my book.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: This item lasted long enough to avoid being able to return it.
customer_reviews.text: This item never stayed up for more than two days running after an initial good period. For that reason I was beyond the return date with Amazon when it started showing its bad side. Now all I have left is useless piece of junk, an expensive piece of junk that won't even suffice as a boat anchor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: mynet 900
customer_reviews.text: well, i bought this one, is supossed to be the best router bla bla , mine wasnt working properly. got a rma replacement by WD, (wd support is truly great). the replacement ,wasnt working properly neither. they gave me a new one, but this time a mynet 900 Central with a 2tb hd in it. and guess what, the router is failing , diffrent issues, is not very stable. anyway, i ended up buying a liknsys.
customer_reviews.author: matias

customer_reviews.title: Not So Great.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this router for the purposes of gaming since I read some recommendations online. It didn't perform for that purpose. Got constant disconnects and lag issues, which were resolved by replacing the router. It was fine for streaming movies and other media though. Returned this item, and had a great customer experience with the seller, databug.
customer_reviews.author: B. Gal

customer_reviews.title: Stay way from this Router
customer_reviews.text: I have to reboot this thing once a day or so. I have tried everything static IP nothing helps. Reange is OK but not great. Time for a TP.
customer_reviews.author: JoeG9100

customer_reviews.title: Good as a wireless access point
customer_reviews.text: I was unable to get this to work in router mode with my existing Vonage router which is NOT wireless and is a piece of crap, 8 years old. They kept fighting with each other even if I turned DHCP off, so I put it into Access Point mode and it works great, very powerful signal all the way to my back yard (about 75 feet) and the product is in our front room. BTW - iPhones are weak, everyone with one has issues with my wireless at my house, but Windows 8 phones and Androids all work excellently.
customer_reviews.author: Nana

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful! Great speed
customer_reviews.text: Currently using it, haven't had any issues, an equivalent one at the local electronics super stores would've cost allot more. Prime has really paid for itself.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey S. Hills

product_meta.title: WD My Net N900 HD Dual Band Router Wireless N WiFi Router Accelerate HD
product_meta.description:
The My Net N900 HD Dual-Band Router accelerates all your entertainment with smart, real-time traffic prioritization that delivers the highest quality streaming with Fastrack Plus technology. With combined wireless speeds up to 900 Mbps, 7 Gigabit ports, and 2 USB ports the My Net N900 is the ultimate entertainment router.

AMAZON.COM




FROM THE MANUFACTURER


MY NET N900 HD DUAL-BAND ROUTER – OUR BEST ROUTER FOR HD ENTERTAINMENT. 
 Accelerate your entertainment with My Net N900 HD Dual-Band Router. FasTrack Plus delivers smart, real-time prioritization of movies, shows, games and video chat for the best possible entertainment experience. It features combined wireless speeds up to 900 Mbps, superior range, 7 Gigabit ports and 2 USB ports.

Accelerate what entertains you.
FasTrack Plus makes these routers even smarter. It instantly analyzes and prioritizes all network traffic and provides more bandwidth to the services that need it, for a brilliant HD experience. Top-of-the-line performance. 
Up to 450 + 450 Mbps speed with dual 2.4 and 5 GHz bands working simultaneously. With superior range-amplifying technology this router provides the best range for larger multi-floor homes. Stress-free setup.
It only takes a few quick steps to set up your My Net N900 router; but you still get plenty of flexibility and control for easy customization. 

Technology:
Brilliant HD streaming with exclusive FasTrack Plus - This technology doesn't just recognize pre-identified popular services and standard data packets like traditional routers. FasTrack Plus instantly analysis and prioritizes all movies, videos, games and chat sessions delivering faster, smoother, HD streaming with more efficient load times - even when it's all happening at the same time.

Speed that keeps up with you - With Dual-Band speeds up to 450 mbps on both the 2.4 and 5 GHz bands, My Net N900 delivers the ultimate Wi-Fi speeds for your entertainment.*

* Maximum wireless performance rate derived from IEEE standard 802.11 specifications. Actual data throughput and wireless coverage may vary based on wireless network capacity, data throughput rate, range and coverage. Performance depends on factors including distance from the access point, volume of network traffic, building materials and construction, operating system used, configuration of wireless products used, interference and other adverse conditions. As used for transfer rate or interface, Megabits per second (Mbps) = 1 million bits per second, Gigabits per second (Gbps) = 1 billion bits per second.

More bandwidth, less interference - Double your bandwidth with 2.4 and 5 GHz bands working simultaneously to increase throughput. Additionally, the 5 GHz band offers a dedicated network that streams your entertainment without interference.

Superior coverage - Range-amplifying technology reduces interference and additional antennas broaden the wireless signal to provide superior coverage for larger, multi-floor homes. Performance for all your Wi-Fi devices. Stream your movies, shows, games, videos and music to all the laptops, tablets and smartphones anywhere in your home.

7 Gigabit Ethernet ports - With 7 Gigabit Ethernet ports you have plenty of high-speed ports at 10x the speed over Fast Ethernet for your connected devices - HD game boxes, media players, Blu-ray Disc players and more.

2 USB ports - The convenient USB ports make it easy to add external storage, shared printers, scanners and other USB devices to your network.

Software:
More control - My Net Dashboard makes it easy for you to customize, monitor or change your network settings. Access parental controls, Internet security, network name and password, printer and scanner settings, and connected storage drive settings all in one easy view.

Parental controls help protect your family - Use the available parental controls to limit the type of websites your children can view, set access and time limits for their web access and set Internet security to prevent malware and spyware attacks.

Keep your network up and running - The included network diagnostics tool monitors your network for you. It shows how many devices are on your network, continually analyzes common network connectivity issues and helps correct them when they occur so you are back up and running quickly.

Share your network with guests - Set up your own secure wireless hotspot in your home so your guests can wirelessly access your network. Password protection allows you to control access to just wireless web browsing.

Setup
Easy setup - WD's streamlined CD or browser setup is designed to get you up and running in minutes with just a few quick steps. You can set up your router with the included easy setup CD or set it up wirelessly with a browser on any of your connected devices. The intuitive user interface is designed for touch screens, making setting up your router on a smartphone or tablet a snap.

Easily connect and expand your network - With UPnP, My Net N900 makes it easy to discover and auto-configure other devices on your network to provide the ultimate entertainment experience.

Add a My Book Live to create your own personal cloud- Connect WD's My Book Live or My Book Live Duo personal cloud storage device to your My Net HD dual-band router to create your own personal cloud solution within your home network.

Push button setup (WPS) - Easily connect new devices to your wireless network with the push of a button. It's as easy as syncing your mobile phone to your Bluetooth device, and within seconds you can expand your network to include PCs, smartphones, tablets, and other UPnP enabled wireless devices.

Advanced QoS (WMM)- In addition to industry-standard Advanced QoS which prioritizes devices, My Net routers feature exclusive FasTrack Plus technology that delivers smart, real-time prioritization of Internet movies, shows, games and video chat for the smoothest possible HD entertainment streaming.

WPA/WPA2, SPI firewall - We protect your wireless network with WPA/WPA2 and SPI firewall security. Only the data you want gets through, hackers are blocked, and your network is protected.

Antenna amplifiers - Built into the sleek design of the routers are multiple antenna amplifiers that help boost the router's range so that you get excellent coverage and speed in almost any size home.

IPv6-enabled - Future-proof your network with support for the latest Internet Protocol technology.

Ideal for

 * Smooth, accelerated streaming of HD movies, shows, games and more
 * Instant recognition and auto-prioritization of all your HD entertainment
 * Streaming multiple HD streams all at the same time with HD-capable Wi-Fi
 * Upgrading to fast dual-band speeds and reducing interference
 * Multi-media households with multiple connected devices
 * Larger, multi-floor homes with superior range
 * Expanding your wired network at 10/100/1000 Gigabit speeds
 * Connecting to your home network in just a few quick steps
 * Setting parental controls and Internet security to keep your family and network safe
 * Providing guest access to your home Wi-Fi network
 * Connecting external storage, shared printers or scanners and other USB devices

What's in the box
HD dual-band router, Setup and resource CD, Ethernet cable, Power adapter, Quick Install Guide.

System Requirements 
CD setup for PC: Windows 7, Windows Vista, Windows XP (SP3)
Web setup for Mac: Safari 2 or higher and type in //wdrouter or 192.168.1.1
Supported browsers for setup and advanced settings: Internet Explorer 7, Safari 2, Firefox 2, Google Chrome 7 or higher. Type in //wdrouter or 192.168.1.1
Note: Compatibility may vary depending on user's hardware configuration and operating system.

For more great WD products, visit the Western Digital Store at Amazon.com

Features at a glance

 * FasTrack Plus technology
 * Simultaneous dual-band - 2.4 and 5 GHz
 * Range-amplifying technology
 * 7 Gigabit Ethernet ports
 * 2 USB ports 
 * My Net software includes parental controls, Internet security, guest access, and network diagnostics
 * Advanced QoS (WMM)
 * WPA/WPA2, SPI firewall security
 * IPv6, WPS, DLNA, UPnP,
   Wi-Fi certified






Wireless Routers 
Comparison Chart My Net N600 My Net N750 My Net N900 My Net N900 Central Fast HD streaming with simple setup. Seamless HD streaming for watching movies on multiple devices. Smart HD streaming for accelerated video to all your Wi-Fi devices. Smart HD streaming for accelerated video plus internal storage for wireless backup. Wi-Fi speed up to 300 + 300 Mbps up to 300 + 450 Mbps up to 450 + 450 Mbps up to 450 + 450 Mbps Dual-band 2.4 and 5 GHz 2.4 and 5 GHz 2.4 and 5 GHz 2.4 and 5 GHz Ethernet ports 4 Fast Ethernet 4 Gigabit Ethernet 7 Gigabit Ethernet 4 Gigabit Ethernet USB ports 1 2 2 1 Advanced QoS Tablet and smartphone friendly IPv6-enabled UPnP/DLNA WPA/WPA2 Security Simultaneous HD streaming Prioritization technology for accelerated HD Streaming FasTrack FasTrack FasTrack Plus FasTrack Plus WD 2go WD Photos Internal Storage Wireless backup 

See more
feature_bullets: Accelerated, seamless HD streaming with instant traffic prioritization
FasTrack Plus for best HD entertainment

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.4 out of 5 stars513 ratings3.4 out of 5 stars
